titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 10) to provide for reform of the intelligence community, terrorism prevention and prosecution, border security, and international cooperation and coordination, and for other purposes.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 241.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-751, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 10 and S. 2845 with 3 hours and 40 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 827.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/7/2004--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 10 (9/11 Recommendations Implementation Act).
